reviews.review_msg: Great person, bad teacher. Had to learn everything from other sources. 6-8hr/week of hw on top of trying to understand the course content. She has an incredibly hard time explaining simple concepts, making it impossible for students to follow. The textbook is ancient so there are no similar questions online to help you out.

Entire semester was a joke; lectures were meaningless, you werent missing much by just skipping. She has no ability to teach important concepts at all. Amazingly enough, this PhD professor managed to confuse even herself by her class notes. Only saving grace was the grading was easy. Not the kind of professor you look for in upper div physics.

Karen is a nice person who wants everyone in the course to do well. However, she isn't good at conveying information AT ALL! Asks us to do roughly 4 hours of homework PER WEEK (average being 10 pages) then gets confused as to why homework averages are so low. Midterms have NOTHING to do with assignments or the text. Avoid at all costs!!!
Excellent ability to communicate material to students.

Weekly Quizzes...lame.  Notes are monotonous.  Expected "activity" in the class is too high for the emphasis she provides.  Marking is hard, and unwilling to correct grading errors.  Stubborn, and "has to get back to you" on questions asked about material.
Talented teacher who works hard to put the material across.  Thermodynamics is hard to make exciting but Dr. Forde does the job as well as it can be.

She definately brought in real life applications to the homework. It made it kind of fun... sticking balloons in your freezer... boiling dry 4L of water... having a poster project. She tried to make thermodynamics more than just engines and pistons. It was great.

Spring 2005 is the first time she taught a course.  She ran the course very creatively. (esp. the poster session)
 Her assignments were challenging but not impossible, and her exams are reasonable.
 It really does make a difference to attend her lectures.
Good teacher, lecture notes are valuble. Assignments are heinously long and often very hard. Makes for a lot of work.

Super nice and friendly prof, always available for extra help definitely reccomend for any class.  Downside he likes to pick the hardest questions out of the textbook and he gets sidetracked easily, but otherwise great prof, very fair exams, exams are based directly off of homework problems so do your homework
